summary: All seven previously-blocking contradictions/verification gaps were addressed with concrete contracts, measurement/validation methods, and scoped acceptance criteria, and the changes did not introduce any new truly blocking issues.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: API Quick-Start/Reference requirements were unverifiable due to missing public contract (base URL/env, credential issuance, streaming protocol, public vs admin endpoints, smoke tests)
previous_issues_status.notes: The PRD now includes a clear Developer-Facing API Contract (localhost:3000 target, JWT ES256+JWKS, SSE, endpoint classification, credential acquisition paths) plus an explicit curl-based smoke-test checklist as a validation gate.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Auth method ambiguity (JWT vs API keys) risked shipping incorrect onboarding steps
previous_issues_status.notes: JWT (ES256 + JWKS) is declared primary with operational steps; API keys are explicitly marked Planned with no operational steps, aligning with the quick-start and acceptance criteria.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Ecosystem stats (LOC/tests/versions) lacked a defined measurement method and would drift / be unverifiable
previous_issues_status.notes: A canonical measurement approach is specified (cloc + test runner output), with required generated_at + commit SHA/tag anchoring and acceptance criteria tying published numbers to script output.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: BUTTERFREEZONE content hashes were underspecified (algorithm, file set/normalization, validation mode), making validation unreliable
previous_issues_status.notes: Hashing is now defined as SHA-256, per-section hashing, normalization rules, explicit exclusion of the meta block, and a validation mode tied to the generating commit/working tree at generation time.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Naming migration policy was contradictory (zero Arrakis vs theme references) and lacked enforceable boundaries
previous_issues_status.notes: The PRD now enumerates zero-tolerance files, exempt/theme directories, and a single-mention historical pattern, with a grep-based validation command integrated into FR-8.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: IaC acceptance implied production-grade deploy while production deployment was out of scope
previous_issues_status.notes: Scope is narrowed to staging/non-production deployment with production hardening as checklist-only; acceptance criteria are aligned (staging deployability + terraform plan validation).

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Truth-grounded citation requirement was impossible for cross-repo claims without stable link rules
previous_issues_status.notes: Cross-repo citation rules now require tags or commit-SHA permalinks and prohibit branch links, with a grep-based acceptance check to prevent drift/link rot.
